intro: Floscopa axillaris, commonly known as the axillary flower plant, is a small, herbaceous species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Its botanical features include a short, branched stem and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer.
